Reviews.Title: “Friendly service and cleanliness make us want to go back.”
Reviews.Author: ThreeRivers944
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff is wonderfully nice and helped us with maps, personalized directions, and with navigating the lobby computer. They even helped us get our boarding passes and recommended great local restaurants. As someone who doesn't travel much, I appreciated the spotlessly clean rooms and the bathrooms looked like they were new. The pricing was very fair, and the breakfast, though not spectacular, provided a good selection and nourishment to get us up and on our way (plus the coffee is good!) It is a busy place, and people arriving late and checking out super early to get to the airport can be a little thoughtless and loud, particularly if you are below them. We may request an upstairs room next time to avoid being awoken at 4 AM. Free parking and wi-fi is a huge bonus. Thank you for a truly wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Johneo_ca
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Lamplighter is really good value for money at under $90 a night including taxes. The staff were very friendly and helpful (I was upgraded to a mini suite for no extra charge). The included "free" morning breakfast has a fairly good selection of items including fresh fruit, and high quality cardboard plates were provided and not the usual cheap plastic ones. Our room was large, exceptionally clean and the bed was very comfortable. Everything worked and the WiFi connection was good. One minor problem, is that the walls are not well insulated (as the property must be over 20 years old) and so we could hear the guests on the floor above walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel For The Price”
Reviews.Author: scottca075
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Lamplighter is not someplace I would recommend to most people unless they are just looking for the cheapest hotel they can find close to San Diego State University. The pluses for the hotel are that it is inexpensive, in a safe neighborhood and clean. If you have a car and want to be as close as possible to SDSU, this isn't a bad choice for cheap rooms. The negatives are that it is not in a good location for sightseeing, is not in a pretty area and there are limited places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Tops in friendly service, cleanliness and amenities.”
Reviews.Author: kayaker49homewood
Reviews.Content: This was an outstanding and lucky choice for us. We were going to a concert at SDSU and were able to walk to it and back. One of the cleanest hotels we have stayed in lately. Quiet and dark window coverings so you did not wake up at the crack of dawn. Coffee available all day long and a good little breakfast available with promises of more to come as they add to their menu. Staff was unbelievably nice....gave us paper plates for our pizza and we were able to print boarding passes for our flights. Pool area was very nice and well maintained. Other hotels in the area are just not on the same par. Free wifi was an added plus. Rooms are nicely decorated with comfy beds and all the amenities one expects. Owners know what they are doing....we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, friendly and clean!”
Reviews.Author: KLM055
Reviews.Content: I stay here frequently when traveling from out of town to visit my daughter who is attending SDSU. It is very convenient to the university and provides good value compared to the other hotels located off of I-8. The staff welcomes me back each time I return and have been very helpful with directions to Costco and places to eat nearby. The rooms are more than adequate to meet my needs and CLEAN. I have already booked a room in May to help my daughter move home for the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Lamplighter Lifesaver”
Reviews.Author: Anaheim_Marilyn
Reviews.Content: Cordial, helpful, considerate staff. Clean & accommodating -- Needed help with amenities following surgery -- all HC-accessible rooms already booked, so management provided step-stool to access tall beds, and provided a sturdy shower-chair for tub. Only downside: no refrigerator in downstairs QQ rooms, cannot safely install in downstairs rooms. Breakfast room remodel is planned, and that's good because this 1st timer was a bit confused. I expected one long buffet counter-top, and I didn't see the items were at 3 different walls. Once I caught-on, I realized had more people been there the separation of categories cut self-service wait-time. Kitchen attendant, front-desk-clerk, and the hotel manager kept eyes on area’s cleanliness, but some of the guests needed lessons in “Self-Maid” manners.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless Night”
Reviews.Author: MsMinnie2
Reviews.Content: Looking forward to good nights rest, guess what, desk attendant calls 12:30 am to advise me they undercharged me for the room an additional .05 was needed? What^ are you kidding me I was sleeping. Next morning manager was unapologetic and very arrogant. Add insult to injury, the breakfast nook was filthy dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ruth S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here many times over the past 5 years when we visit our family in the area, and we really like this place. The rooms are extremely clean. If it's available we try to get the mini-suite, which is comfortable and spacious with sofa, comfy chairs, microwave and fridge, and an excellent wi-fi connection. Overall, the place is quiet and well taken care of, with pretty flowers and a super-clean heated pool, and the staff is always extremely helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Douglas C
Reviews.Content: Lamplighter met all my criteria for a good stay: the room was clean, quiet, didn't smell, and was well furnished. Ours had a kitchen area where we could make small meals and had all the essentials of cutlery, plates, etc. we needed. We didn't try the outdoor pool but I saw it be cleaned. The waffle maker wasn't in operation because of their breakfast area renovation, but they still had a nice selection of selection cereals, bagels, oatmeals, and fruit available. As others have noticed, the landscaping is very nice, with attractive flowers growing along the walkway. I felt that the manager was very responsive in my one request. Our family would definitely choose them again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra W
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be a home away from home. The room was very clean, the housekeeping service did a very nice job.The grounds and pool area were very well maintained There was a great gas grill for the guests to use, which we took advantage of. The beds were comfortable and there were plenty of towels in the bathroom. The breakfast was always well stocked and the availability to "rent" DVD's (for free) was a nice touch. The front desk staff were very polite and accommodating. The only minor complaint that we have has nothing to do with the hotel itself but the guests, the guest who chose to smoke outside of their rooms often threw their cigarette butt into the parking lots rather than using an ashtray which was not only unsightly but unsafe for those that don't have shoes on. We would defintely return to the Best Western Lamplighter Inn in the future!

Reviews.Title: “clean, basic accomodation w/microwave & fridge”
Reviews.Author: PULAOKHAO
Reviews.Content: best western diamond elite member; paid $64+tax in december-2011 which is good rate for value received; appreciate upgrade to family suite with kitchen with utensils and separate bedroom and living room; ralphs and vons grocery stores, walgreens,, cvs near by; some restaurants near by but did not try them clean, comfortable basic accommodation; chose for high traveladvisor rating and not disappointed except for minor irritants as detailed below; helpful, courteous staff; older property but well maintained; nice firm comfortable beds; plenty of clean towels bulbs above sink outside bathroom burnt out but not replaced for two days despite request; at arrival, room very clean but housekeeping didn't clean interior of microwave where previous guest left spilled coffee & half full coffee cup but i didn't report instead cleaned myself; flat screen tv in bedroom goes blank for 30 seconds each time channel changed [most annoying] so instead watched CRT tv in living room; stayed 3 nights but housekeeping never left fresh paper coffee mugs or condiments packet until i left note asking for them; very clean room and well maintained property; realize breakfast under reconstruction but general quality & variety of breakfast items poorer than comparable hotels; provided soap, shampoo and lotion but no conditioner would definitely stay here again & would recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Annrkatz
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the BW Lamplighter Inn for nearly 10 years, when we visit our kids and grandkids. The staff is attentive and helpful and the owners really keep up with the maintenance. The landscaping is lovely - lots of flowers and much nicer than you would expect for the price. The beds are comfortable and they have nice linens and even comfy feather pillows. The pool is spotless and usually heated and they are dog-friendly too. The only thing lacking for me is a jacuzzi! We are always treated like family and we just love staying at his great little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: HeatherDH
Reviews.Content: Our overall experience here was very pleasant and I can't say enough nice things about all the staff. In particular the front desk staff were really helpful and always cheerful and polite. We stayed at the Lamplighter for two full weeks and therefore got a very fair "weekly rate" for a small room but with a complete kitchenette plus the provided continental plus breakfast (which they are in the process of changing). We also found the bed very comfortable and it had a good shower that always had hot water. The rooms were very clean and well maintained. For our room, the only drawback was that the air conditioner gave off a bit of a musty smell (I didn't notice the same problem in my sister's room - which was also much roomier) however it worked. Our unit had a kitchen window so we could often get some cooler evening air and turn off the air conditioner. When we had a faucet problem in the kitchen, it was repaired within an hour of us reporting it. A Ralph's was only a few blocks away which made it easy to stock up on food so we could make a lot of our meals.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay- clean and quiet with a friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ryan L
Reviews.Content: The Lamplighter Inn is my "home away from home." When I come down to San Diego for work, I will typically stay here for a couple weeks at a time. The quality of service I have received from Len and the rest of the staff has been exceptional. The room is clean and quiet, and if you need to book a longer stay their weekly rate is a very good value. They even have a nice selection of DVD movies you can check out from the front desk for free. A well-run establishment that is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Ornit G
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed very much the large suite with the kitchen, but it was a bit too expensive overall. Breakfast was minimal and crowded (but they are restructuring their breakfast). There was a strange smell in the room (maybe too old carpets). Seems like very nice guests, but not much families with small kids. Overall, next time I may search higher-starred hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the value”
Reviews.Author: carol k
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three weeks while we visited our son,daugher-inlaw and family nearby. The staff (Len, Vanessa) were so very friendly, helpful and efficient for those who want to stay longer term. The grounds are very well kept and beautiful. Rooms were very clean and housekeeping did a very good job. The rooms may be dated a bit but the other attributes out weigh the minor items.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the family”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: Thank You Lamplighter Inn for great service and a comfortable stay. The beds were very comfortable and the staff was great. The kitchen was under construction, so they upgraded us free of charge, to the family suite. The kitchen in the suite had everything imaginable for a family traveling; Vons supermarket is just up the street. The wireless worked great. I would have liked less livingroom and more eating space for the children; It was a little messy eating in the livingroom area. The DVD players and two televisions were very nice for the kids/adults. All attractions were near (within 30 minutes) and parking free and right outside my door. The staff was very familiar with the area attractions and offered tips. The bathroom was basic and clean. I would have liked more area /shelving for toiletries in the separate sink area. The washroom was clean but was only open fom 9a-8p and often times we left/came home before or after that time. The pool was clean to look at, but it was too cool outside to use it. I would recommend tis hotel to any family traveling with kids to the San Diego area. It is much less expensive then the other hotels closer to the attractions but with many more free amenites like breakfast/parking. There are not many family restaurants in the area so plan ahead. We stayed four nights.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: rcbeltiefarm
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 days in October 2011, & were very pleased with our accommodations. We rented a car, so the location was fine. A little extra driving, but easy to get on & off I-8. The grounds were very pretty. Landscaping, flowers, very clean. We choose a King size bed, with microwave & refrig. The room was small, but the arrangement was efficient, with a good bed. I requested a ground floor & mentioned I had a bum knee when making reservations. We got a ground floor unit, equipped for the disabled. It was nice to have the extra safety bars in the bathroom, & the bathroom was extra large & would have accommodated a wheel chair. The staff was excellent. Well informed about the area & helpful in every way.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are true!”
Reviews.Author: guiatr167
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lamplighter for 10 days in August. We were given a room on the second floor which did not seem to be connected to any other rooms, other than the one below us. This was good as we were travelling with an infant. While the place has likely not been renovated since the 1980's or before, the place has been VERY well maintained. I used to always get rooms on Priceline, minimum 4 stars, whenever we travelled. This time however, the prospect of travelling with an 8 month old and staying in a hotel for 10 days with no kitchen facilities made me think about other alternatives for this trip. I needed a place with a full kitchen, and this place provided that at a very reasonable price. The room was super clean, the carpets were definitely newer and also very clean. We even saw a carpet cleaning company cleaning some rooms while we were there. The staff was very friendly and the pool is also very nice. Make no mistake, this is not a 5* hotel, but for a 2* motel, this place was way better than I ever expected. It was cleaner than may of the 4* properties I have stayed at. Linens were fresh and beds were very comfortable. I have only stayed at 2* properties a few times before and those experiences were nothing like this place. This place is only 2* because it is a motel-style facility whose appearance could benefit from a face-lift. My only complaint would be to have the hotel invest in an air deflector for the air conditioner. It was blowing next to my head every night. For all I know, they may have had one, but I never asked. Other than that, I only have positives to say about this place. The freeway is close by. The zoo is something like 15 minutes from there. Forget doing anything in the area around the hotel, there isn't much there for tourists. However, rent a car and you're well-located to conveniently experience all that San Diego has to offer. I would definitely stay here again. Believe the reviews that you read here. They are true!

Reviews.Title: “It was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Lissa L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights just last week. Found it through the reviews here. We had the Mini suite with full kitchen #220. Everything was very clean (didn't see any bugs). The bathroom was big enough. Front desk was polite and courteous. I didn't have the chance to meet Len or David although we emailed over reservations. Each cleaning service was perfect and the person doing this was very friendly. She always stocked clean towels for us, garbage & recycle matter disposed off. We always come back to a very well cleaned room each day. As they are redesigning their breakfast menu, breakfast was prepackaged. It wasn't too bad. Location of the hotel is pretty central to everywhere. I-8 is easily accessible. As another reviewer has mentioned, neighbourhood is not the best but it is safe and quiet. My kids love the heated pool. On our last day there, it was raining heavily and windy, my daughter still insisted in swimming in the pool. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches, Rude Personnel, Postage-Stamp Bathroom (no counter space at all)”
Reviews.Author: lizamaylizamay
Reviews.Content: ENORMOUS roaches in the drawers crawling through my underwear, in the bathroom cup holding my toothpaste and toothbrush, in the kitchen crawling over the silverware - EEEEEW. Len Regan, office manager, called this morning yelling that we would be reported for engaging in criminal activity because we took a towel off the cart sitting outside our room (no housekeeping anywhere in site all morning - guests have been coming to the cart all day to get clean towels) and then hung up on me! Wow. When I walked up to the office to say he should not have spoken that way he interrupted loudly repeating over and over that he is never rude to customers he's always extremely polite - I simply could not get a word in. Not the least hint of an apology for the impolite call, for the lack of housekeeping service, for telling a guest (we arrived late last night! supposedly for a ten-day stay! what a welcome! wow!) that they'd be reported for criminal activity! For taking a clean towel off the cart! Wow! We are an older couple who travel almost every weekend of the year, all around the country. Never stayed in a Best Western before. What a mistake this was! We will never EVER ever stay in a Best Western again. My advice to anyone reading this: Avoid this motel! Unless you like roaches and extremely rude treatment. And no clean towels. Wow.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Principeza
Reviews.Content: This was our first family trip to San Diego and we were referred to the Lamplighter, we were not disappointed. Staff was very friendly, knowledgeable with were to eat, where to go with accurate directions. It was very quite we slept very well, clean and spacious. A very cute place, would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet place with great value!”
Reviews.Author: R2NAZ
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying here after reading other glowing reviews and I was not disappointed! The hotel was quiet and we felt comfortable leaving the door open while visiting with other family also staying at the hotel. The rooms are clean and comfortable and so are the beds. The grounds are well maintained and the pool looked inviting although we didn’t have a chance to go in. The staff is friendly, accommodating and attentive to guest needs. We called after booking online to upgrade our room to a room with a full kitchen. This was great because we didn’t have to take up the bathroom counter space for washing bottles and it gave us space for a pack & play. We still had room to move around and sit on the couch too. The rooms with kitchens are great because they are in a separate building and are right next to the pool. The breakfast options were plentiful, cereal, waffles, fruit, etc. There are several grocery stores nearby, a few fast food places and Starbucks is just down the street. This hotel is not right next to Sea World or San Diego Zoo, but it’s only a 10 minute drive and 20 to Coronado. It’s less expensive than staying right next to the attractions and it is a nice hotel. If traveling to the San Diego area we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraLA
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel more of a motel not much to look at but room super inside. Would use it for a one night stop off again. Not much selection or room for breakfast but free and can take back to room. Dont see any staff and pool ony just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Find in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: RamboSacto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very happy with this stay. Breakfast consisted of: waffles, oatmeal, cereal, pastries, boiled eggs, baggles, coffee, and juice. Small eating area with about 6 tables The workers worked hard to keep food and drinks stocked. Good size room. Two queens, sink with long counter outside the toilet/tub shower. 3 chairs plus an ottoman available for sitting. There was also a desk and dresser along with a small refrigerator. DVDs were available for checkout. I was on the 2nd floor that had exterior halls and no elevators. This was a pretty quite place, I couldn’t hear my neighbors but could hear a few people walking outside. Also pretty clean. Location about 10 miles from downtown. Traffic wasn’t bad commuting in and out. Staff was pretty helpful when I asked about the Transit System downtown and its fare. I’d definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with the family”
Reviews.Author: bouldercitizen
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure what this hotel would be like because it isn't located downtown, the only part of the city we were familiar with until our trip in August 2011. We had a great experience in this hotel, near the university and a quick ride to the zoo and everything else in town. Had fantastic Laotian food close by and loved the big suite and the friendly staff. The kids adored the pool and I liked the very well-maintained landscaping and the exceptionally helpful manager. We'd definitely stay here again. The price is fantastic and everything was clean, handy and comfortable. Kitchen very well outfitted and we were well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value for Comic-Con Attendees”
Reviews.Author: v3ryb0r3dguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from July 20th to 24th because my girlfriend and I were going to attend Comic-Con International 2011. We had previously stayed here a few years ago and decided to stay here again because the price was very reasonable compared to other hotels in the San Diego area. Overall, the room was very clean and quaint. There was nothing modern/fancy about it, but it felt very homey. It was so "old-fashioned" that even the TV was an "old" CRT instead of an LCD. The room that we booked was a suite-style room that included a full kitchen. The room even had a full size refrigerator that we took full advantage of by stocking it up with drinks and breakfast foods. And in the morning, because of the full kitchen, we could actually "cook" food with the stove. The only negative I could come up with was that there was no cookie sheet available to use with the oven (so I could bake a pizza and breadsticks). I called the lobby and they said they didn't provide it even though they had virtually all other kitchen tools/utensils. Overall, I'd rate this a 4 out of 5 and would definitely come here again. P.S. the wafflemaker they have when they have the daily continental breakfast was pretty good/fun!

Reviews.Title: “It'll do”
Reviews.Author: wishIwerent_here
Reviews.Content: This was a basic hotel with a laundry room, nice pool area, okay breakfast and somewhat standard rooms. I would stay here again, especially if I was visiting someone at SDSU. Otherwise, the location is nothing to write about.

Reviews.Title: “I hope to stay again”
Reviews.Author: Bussy01
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was CLEAN and the employees were all so nice and helpful. The manager (I wish I had his name) was exceptional in his customer service. I hope Best Western recognizes what an asset he is. Thank you Sir for your courteous and professional manner. The breakfast room was wonderful, perfect for myself and my two year old Granddaughter. The food was fresh, there was a good variety and the coffee wasn't weak! As far as comfort goes, OMG we all slept so well. The bed and pillows were awesome. My daughter and I are both going to try to find feather pillows that mimic the ones at this Hotel. My only negative comment is that there was no fridge in the room. I guess a few other Hotels have spoiled me with this extra and it has become a huge plus to me in my travels. I prefer to visit a grocery store rather than to eat out all the time so Best Western, give me a place to store my fresh food! To sum up our stay here; The room was clean and comfortable. The employees are friendly and helpful. The location was close enough to everything you'd want to visit in San Diego. They let us bring our Dog, an important member of our family.

Reviews.Title: “Everything You'd Expect”
Reviews.Author: StuHermosaBeach
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night because downtown was booked and expensive. It was near SDSU, a short drive from downtown, where we spent the day. The place was clean and well kept. The check-in staff was friendly, efficient and capable. Not the Ritz, but...

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel to stay for business”
Reviews.Author: AKI2505
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June 2011 for 4 days and enjoyed it very much. Rooms were very large, clean and user-friendly. Breakfast was excellent, everything you needed. Front office staff very helpful, friendly and efficient. Only drawback, rooms are a bit dark.

Reviews.Title: “Charming & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: guar9692
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews from fellow travelers, my daughter and I decided to stay here while vacationing in San Diego. We loved this hotel!!! It has a unique atmosphere, a friendly and courteous staff, and clean, comfortable rooms. I agree with other reviewers that coming back to this hotel at the end of the day feels like "coming home." I used to live in San Diego and return as often as I can. This has become my new favorite place to stay in the San Diego area. Our only complaint was the continental breakfast, which didn't offer many food choices and was held in a room that was too small to accomodate more than a handful of guests. Overall, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Len was great; they take care of you”
Reviews.Author: daviddmarsh
Reviews.Content: Len, at front desk, was kind and helpful - really made you feel at home. You don't get that too often. Price was right, rooms nice and clean. Good pool. Located a bit away from the main areas of interest, but freeway close. And the "Continental" free breakfast more than usual - also had waffles, cereal, fruit, nice baked goods.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money”
Reviews.Author: Konadream
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over the weekend because our usual hotels were booked. It is the "best" Best Western I have stayed in. We had a queen with full kitchen in the small building by the pool. I was a little concerned at first about noise since we were so close to the pool, but it was never a problem. The room was clean and spacious. The only drawback was it smelled a little as if someone had smoked in it (supposed to be non-smoking), but after we opened the door for a few minutes it was fine. The grounds are beautifully maintained and all the staff we came in contact with was friendly and professional. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who didn't have a lot of money to spend but wanted a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Len Front Desk Agent (Great)!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ulovjen
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying this property is great!!!!! Len the Front Desk Agent there is one of the most helpful people I have come across while traveling anywhere. He told me the right places to go and check out and his attitude is that of such positivity!!!! Thank You! Len should be acknowledged for his outstanding customer service skills!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: kiowa1955
Reviews.Content: Beautiul flowers and landscaping Clean comfortable room Perfect in every way Definitely will return

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best - Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: foxmum66
Reviews.Content: I booked this motel based on TA reviews and I could not have been happier. David Birt, the manager, was so helpful from my very first email asking for prices, and this friendliness/helpfulness continued right throughout our stay. My family (me, husband, 5 kids aged 5-12) stayed in a 1 bedroom family suite which had 2 queen beds in the bedroom, a fold out sofa in the lounge, and full kitchen. David allowed us to have an additional trundle bed in the living area for no extra charge. The room whilst not overly large was certainly perfectly adequate for our stay of 6 nights with a large group. The beds were excellent, the room was clean and well maintained - the cleaning staff even made up the kids beds putting their teddy bears on the middle of the pillows - lovely personal touch. The kitchen had full range and stove and microwave - we brought a lot of groceries and made our own meals without any problems. We thought that the free breakfast was fantastic - waffles (kids loved being able to make these themselves - David even made them some as he wandered through the breakfast room one morning as the waffles had stuck and he helped the kids scrape it off, got the machine oiled and then made them a replacement). Other items were cereal, bagels, toast, hard boiled eggs, coffee, hot chocolate, juice, fresh fruit, muffins and pastries. We had our breakfast later in the morning around 9.30am and never had a problem with the breakfast room being full. Free wi-fi worked fine, laundry facilities were a big bonus for us - not having to hunt down a laundromat around the motel. There is a pool that the kids used, and also a bbq in the pool area which we used also. Yes, it is located away from the main tourist areas of San Diego, however we had a rental car and found it very easy to get to where we wanted to go and most places only took about 20 minutes. We never had a problem with noise from other rooms at any time during our stay. Highly recommend this motel as being the best place that we stayed during our 5-6 week USA trip - great value for money, very friendly staff, and great rooms!!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: mphammerhead1
Reviews.Content: hotel very clean inside and out. staff helpful and pleasant. beds and pillows fantastic. have stayed here and will continue to stay here when ever we come to san diego

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: pfors
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a little over a week and were very satisfied as we got what we expected after having done our tripadvisor research. We stayed in a standard room with two quuen beds and I must say the beds where really comfortable. The room was well tidied and the linen was whole and clean. The rooms where quiet and we never heard any traffic although the hotel was next to El Cajon blvd. (Rooms aprox in the middle of the hotel) The breakfast was OK. Bagles, 2 kinds of toast. fresh waffles, 3 kinds of cereal, instant oatmeal, coffe, tea, orange & apple juice. Muffins and pastries. The breakfast area was a little small, but you could also sit in the pool area. The staff was very polite and helpful. We bought tickets to Seaworld, got restarant tips and also borrowed a corkscrew and a scale to weigh our luggage. The pool was warm and most probably heated and the pool area was nice and clean. (open 7am-10pm) The outside area was very clean and the flowers were well kept. The neighbouring area is nothing special but I would like to recommend two restaurants. Casa Machado (mexican) and Cucina Fresca (Italian).

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: RitaA73
Reviews.Content: For the money we paid, I did not expect the service and the room we got. The plan was to spend most of the time driving around and sightseeing, so we were not looking for an expensive hotel, but for a place to sleep over and be out in the morning again. To our surprise, the hotel was very welcoming with great landscaping and a nice little pool. There is also a great mexican restaurant one block away with amazing margaritas and food - Casa Machado, so we ended up spending more time in the hotel and around than we originally planed and we greatly enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs!”
Reviews.Author: Jessielyse
Reviews.Content: We love the Lamplighter Inn in San Diego. Although it has a 'motel' look (two story buildings with outside doors) it is well maintained and has well kept grass, plants and flowers which give it a more friendly feel. There is a small but clean pool which is set up with beach chairs with towels on them for your convenience. There is a nice little breakfast set up (pastries, bagels, cereal and make your own waffles) served until 10am every morning. Its a great way to start the day and save a bit of money on food. We stayed in a suite which was very spacious (small sitting room with a pullout couch and then an attached room with a nice sided bed) and perfect for me, my husband and our young son (there's no door between the rooms - so don't look for privacy). One of the best features is Len - a member of staff at the hotel. He is very friendly, seems to know most everyone by their name and is a fount of information. We checked in daily with him for the scoop on things we were considering seeing. The only downside to the hotel is the location. Its not terrible - but its not a 'walking' friendly place. There are a lot of little local shops (drug stores, nail salons, that sort of thing) but nothing necessarily 'pretty' or tourist friendly places. That being said, it is very easy to get in a car and drive to many of main attractions of San Diego - and the staff is more than happy to give you driving information to them. Our original plan was to stay in Old Town (which after seeing we absolutely love!) but the hotels were sold out. If you're looking for a decent place to rest your head and are willing to hop in your car for short distances to get to places than I would recommend the Lamplighter.

Reviews.Title: “Just like coming home every day!”
Reviews.Author: Jillhatt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with my parents stayed for a week. My parents had a room and we had a room with a small kitchenette. I have never experienced such great hospitality as we had during our stay at this inn. The staff and management treated us like family, it was great to see their smiling faces every day and they went out of their way to make our stay more enjoyable. From donating some paper plates for our picnic lunch to taking pictures of us to greeting us every morning at the complimentary breakfast, to talking and laughing with our housekeeper over a few language barriers, we felt like one big happy family. The rooms were clean, there was a supermarket and gas station just down the street and the nights were very quiet. As we were so close to the main highway we were no farther than 20 minutes to get to most of the main attractions in San Diego. We also had use of their barbecue which was awesome. We loved it, loved it, loved it! We will definitely return to this Inn and see more sites that San Diego has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Super great!”
Reviews.Author: Sylviebkrt
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel, the bedroom was clean and the bed very comfortable (we had a king size). The breakfast is free I like their coffie and the food is good. The atmosfeer is very great and the hotel is very cute!! You have internet connection for free and the staff is great and ready to help you!! Very good experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful atmosphere, very clean rooms that provide a restful stay.”
Reviews.Author: rosabe
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised to find this hotel provid everything I needed for this business trip. The contitnental breakfast was perfect - more items to choose from than I could eat. The rooms were spotlessly clean and well maintained. The personel were friendly and helpful. There are many eating options nearby for everyone. The pool was also clean and the water clear. Nice for a bit of time in the sun!

Reviews.Title: “Superb customer service, caring and thoughtful staff.”
Reviews.Author: NickLiv
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property with my daughter while we visited SDSU. We arrived very early in the morning and my daughter was sick. Len (Front Desk Manager) was very accommodating to us and helped us with an early check in which I greatly appreciated. The room was neat and tidy, the service from housekeeping was very good. Overall the property was a pleasant surprise. Len has also suggested a terrific restaurant (D.Z .Akin's) and we ended up having four meals there in a day and a half. Very good Deli food, almost like Katz's in NYC. The stay at this property made are trip enjoyable. Oh yes, and university parents, you will be very please with the location to the campus.

Reviews.Title: “Home in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: JuanneCosta
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Bed with plenty of pillows, room big, clean and silent. It was easy to set up our laptop using a wireless internet connection. The breakfast was so good, with a waffle machine.

Reviews.Title: “Completely met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: SuzeQ1
Reviews.Content: WE stayed for 7 days-Very good breakfast, good beds, good location, good value. The proprietors were right on top of everything. The rooms have been recently updated with granite counter tops and new carpeting.

Reviews.Title: “The Cleanest and Friendliest Motel in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Shimpock
Reviews.Content: My daughter moved to San Diego to complete her masters degree at SDSU a year and a half ago. Needless to say her apartment cannot accommodate her parents! We have stayed in 4 star hotels downtown and other motels far away from her apartment. We discovered this by chance when she moved closer to school. My daughter's boyfriend went and checked up on this facility and we took a chance. I cannot say enough about how accommodating the staff was when we had a glitch in our plans. We arrived to find a lovely, clean and comfortable room ready an hour early. We stayed two nights and the experience was better than our 4 star hotel in downtown as far as the staff friendliness and cleanliness of our room. There was a continental breakfast every morning and coffee in the room with a little fridge and microwave. The neighborhood is a little off the beaten track but close to all the attractions within 15-20 minutes. I am so pleased with our experience that I am going to make this the place we stay when visiting our daughter. I am not sure if all the Best Westerns are as great as this, but this one is outstanding! As a bonus, it is pet friendly and reasonably priced for your pet. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, convenient location for my family, nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: wenzl4
Reviews.Content: The staff helped me find a room for an extended stay and the manager even upgraded my reservation. That doesn't happen often, but its nice to know that they were sensitive to my needs for the week.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Bed - Quiet Setting - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: 1Pocahontas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights. The people at the front desk were always friendly and helpful. Any requests were met promptly. Our hotel room was clean and the king size bed surprisingly comfortable (we like firm) with plenty of pillows - six for two of us. It was easy to set up our laptop using a wireless internet connection - and the hotel setting was quiet and yet conveniently located near shops and restaurants. We also enjoyed a nice breakfast - mostly cold but a couple of hot food items - a tad room for improvement .They gave us an upgrade from a room with a queen size bed to a king size bed for the same price. Total cost including tax for four nights came to $357 (that's about $89 per night). We'd definitely stay again if we're in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Older motel well maintained”
Reviews.Author: Professor_Pi
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at this motel and it continues to by a very pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “the best best western in california”
Reviews.Author: Donaldc1955
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many best westerns, the lamplighter is one of the best for several reasons, staff, maid servic e,the grounds and the cleanliness of the entire hotel, the staff is exceptional, always helpful and knowledgeable & friendly. the continental breakfast is not just a piece of toast and coffee, they have it all, waffles, eggs, muffins and juices to name a few, plus it's fresh......my stay was extened and i am glad i stayed here, i had no trouble at all and looking forward to a return trip. you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as everyone claims”
Reviews.Author: RememberNovember
Reviews.Content: I used TripAdvisor to find the best rated hotels or motels in San Diego 2 years ago.....and this Lamplighter came up as being in the top 5 value/highest rated motels in San Diego. I've been wanting to stay here for 2 years and I finally did , and it was a let down. I think it's overpriced for what it is. It's a basic Best Western. It doesn't have anything interesting (that I want) around it. It has a mortuary, a Rite-Aid, a tattoo shop, a bar called "Effins", and a place that had a menu in our room called "Cheba Hut". Needless to say we drove out of our way to look for shopping and better food. I was happy that our room had a microwave and fridge, but we only used the fridge for our bottled water. The bathrroms are hilariously small. I laughed at the toilet because the opening is too small to use. It doesn't accomodate a large butt. When we got into our room we did the thing we always do....lift the mattress and check for bed bugs. We noticed under each mattress had extra sheets or blankets under the mattress. Under the second mattress we noticed blood or a "red stained substance" on the sheet underneath the mattress. The leg on the table by the doof was about to break off. It was bent inwards like it was about to snap off. I moved it back in its original position so the table wouldn't collapse. Walking on the carpet turned my feet black. It looked like someone seriously cracked the front of the sink, but there was a line where it was glued together, so the motel made an attempt to fix that. When I took a hot shower in the morning I didn't get enough hot water. It ran out about 8-10 minutes into the shower. The steps going up to the second floor by room 218 were burned out at night ao it was very dark. Please fix that. i almost mis-stepped and fell. It's a small parking lot and very tight parking. The walls are very thin. I could hear arguments, conversations, tv's, toilets flushing and showering through them. Also, if get a room on the bottom floor...be prepared to have headlights shining through your window when a car parks. Headlights are at eye level with the motel windows. All in all, I think the people who own this motel try very hard to make this a nice place. There's a dog park behind the motel. They have a continental breakfast in the morning, but I didn't use it. That's a nice thing for guests. They have a dvd player in the room, and i think they have dvd's at the front desk to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if it is even close”
Reviews.Author: tsainta
Reviews.Content: Great little motel. Spotless, great rates, very convenient to San Diego State University, and not too far from Qualcomm Stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Great motel”
Reviews.Author: tomK4870
Reviews.Content: I arrived to San Diego from New York, and for less than half of the price of the NY hotel, I got much better accomodation. I enjoyed the 3 days I stayed here. Room was comfy and spacious. The breakfast area could have been a little bigger, I imagine during main season you might need to take the food back to your room. Location was great, plenty of restaurants and shops around on the boulevard and it seemed safe. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Yorbajsmc
Reviews.Content: The manager Len Regan is wonderful, helpful, friendly and accomodating. We came early, but he let us checked in. We booked a double queen room, and he upgraded our room to a suite. It was a nice room with a sitting area and a fully supplied kitchen. We did not have a chance to use this, because we stayed only for one night. Everything was clean, and the beds firm and comfortable. We all had a good night sleep. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If this is one of best..the rest are?”
Reviews.Author: ralphh909
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights while visiting San Diego. Stayed there based on reviews. The place is okay. Clean rooms and decent breakfast. It's a motel so you park in front of your room and walk in. The walls are thin so 'everything' the neighbors do you hear. I would not walk in area after dark and there are no good resturants in local area. You need to drive far to reach zoo, beach, etc. If you want a cheap, clean motel, look no further. It really makes me wonder though about the quality of lodging in San Diego. If this place is number 6, what are the rest of the places like?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I came to San Diego for vacation with my wife and someone recommended us the Howard johnson. We arrived late at night tired and exhausted wow did we have a surprise. Broken door stained walls the toilet wouldn't flush broken air conditioner smelled bad so the next morning we went to look for a new hotel and right next door from this howard johnson was this best western. From the minute we arrived we were so impressed with cleanliness service beautiful rooms. But it was more expensive then the Howard Johnson. And it was almost worth the price. So listen guys u get what u pay 4.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be top value!”
Reviews.Author: lolo33116
Reviews.Content: We come back from a 3 days trip in San Diego and do not understand at all why this hotel has such good reviews. The location is very inconvinient, far from the center. The room are ok but nothing exceptional. The kitchen is quite old. The breakfast is not very fresh. It seems that one can get a much much better location for the same service, after all it looked like a very "basic" motel. Unless you are going to SDSU look elsewhere. XXXXX from Sweden

Reviews.Title: “The best service and value for money out of anywhere we stayed in California”
Reviews.Author: Turnertribe
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 4 children at this hotel for 3 nights earlier this month while touring around California. We would agree that the location of the hotel is not ideal (in a residential/colllege area some way from the centre) and the rooms are not over-spacious but all the staff without exception are charming and friendly and couldn't do more to help. A good example was that having had one night with six of us squeezed into a family suite we arranged to have an adjoining room at a good price. They were also really helpful about what to do in San Diego. After sight-seeing we all really enjoyed the pool and meeting a vareity of other guests who were all lovely. This hotel seems to attract nice people - as staff and guests - and therefore we left with a lovely feeling about it.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: BeeSkip
Reviews.Content: The Lamplighter was a gem !! We stayed at this property for 3 nights. The rooms are typical rooms but clean and the bedding very comfortable. The office staff are very pleasant, nice and helpful. There is a nice pool, landscaped beautifully and it is a great place to relax in the afternoon. The breakfast each morning was nice and fresh, good coffee but the breakfast room is not too big...got crowded at times..Convenient to all areas of San Diego, we loved our stay here at this very comfortable Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: JANINE
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a college visit to nearby San Diego State in April 09 and returned here with another family for a four-day visit of all the surrounding sites. Nothing has changed -- the Lamplighter is very clean, the staff is extremely friendly and helpful, and we loved hanging out by the small pool for an hour or two every night before we trekked into San Diego, Coronado or Mission Bay for dinner. Small breakfast room but complimentary assortment of juices, waffles, breads and cereals to savor each morning. All the comforts of home!!

Reviews.Title: “Value only goes as far as convenience is a part”
Reviews.Author: marcjenks
Reviews.Content: I have some positive things to say, but I confess after reading all of the glowing reviews, I expected more. It is a very nice, clean, recently remodeled motel and not a bit more. The rooms are barely average in size. The location is not convenient, unless you are here for SDSU. If you do not have a car, do not stay here. We came for the sights and hundreds of hotels/motels are better located for the price. If we are 20+minutes from anything (like here) the prices should be in the $75-$90 range. This is a fantastically remodeled motel. The rooms are super clean with no funny smells. The traffic is light (no freeway/train/plane noise). The staff is 100% customer service oriented. I really believe they would do almost anything for their patrons. The beds are the Simmons Beautyrest line (very very soft, but with adequate support). The breakfast is very well done. The one huge problem is the crowded parking area that doesn't have much room to back out of without risk of hitting cars parked behind. There would be no where to park trailers, large trucks, etc. This is the limit of the original design and there is no way to improve it. The owners really have perfected everything possible. Big tip: consider the upper rooms if you want quiet. We are in 112 (1st floor) and for 3 nights have heard every footfall above. I'm writing this after 11pm in the room right now (pound, pound, pound). Yes, I would recommend this to a friend, but with the hundreds of motels and hotels in San Diego competing for your business in this recession, you can expect to find more value somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable, friendly, inviting...best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: linsuelou3
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd stay with the Lamplighter Inn and we will continue to come back each time we stay in San Diego. The rooms are extremely clean (and no chemical odors like many other hotels we've stayed in), quiet and comfortable. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The hotel is doggy friendly. They have wonderful perks like breakfast, coffee any time in rooms and in the lobby, free wi fi in rooms, computer & printer also available in the lobby, TV with cable, and a beautiful heated pool. The beds are comfortable & they have lots of pillows. This is probably the finest small Best Western we have ever stayed in...and we have stayed in a lot. Make your reservations early because it was sold out each night we stayed there. Congratulations Mr. Birt on having a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Questionable Location”
Reviews.Author: sparklefeb
Reviews.Content: Traveling with our 2 young boys to Sea World, we were looking for a nice, inexpensive place to stay. This hotel had a very nice staff, our room was clean and quiet, but the overall area was questionable. Located about 10-15 minutes away from Sea World, this hotel made us forget we were in beautiful San Diego. The room was a good size for all 4 of us and the continental breakfast was good. So all in all, the hotel was worth the price, I only wish the area surrounding the hotel was a bit nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Not on the beach - but close”
Reviews.Author: Professor_Pi
Reviews.Content: This is a small older motel but well kept up. Parking is tight but the rooms are clean and comfortable. This was our second stay at this motel and we found the staff helpful and knowledgeable. We think it is one of the best values in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Believe what they're saying...this is a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: jmpatrick63
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice experience at this Best Western. The hotel was easy to find and close to loads of restaurants, attractions, etc. Check in was easy and the staff honored our room location requests. Speaking of the staff: very nice and welcoming. They were helpful when giving us directions to the restaurant we were looking for. The free breakfast was what we expected. Gotta say, the pool was the best on our entire trip. The pool is large, clean, and has a nice deep end. Too many places nowadays have these pools that max out at 5 feet. Too shallow! There was plenty of room in the shallow end for the younger kids...and plenty of room in the deep end for the big kids. And it was WARM...the warmest we've found. This is a motor lodge, so we were able to park right next to our room. Nothing like being able to crack the blinds and see your car safe and sound in the morning. The free internet worked fine. Highly recommend this Best Western if you're in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best kept secrets of San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: jdree
Reviews.Content: I've been to many a hotel in the San Diego area over the past 20 years, always searching for a nice, clean, safe, and above all, quiet place to call home for 4 nights while going to the madness of Comic Con. This place was practically perfect in every way! It's a short distance from the downtown San Diego area, near the best kept secret of a freeway...a merciful short hop without traffic! The place looks newly painted, and the doors seem to be either new or resealed, because the noise was non-existent, and they felt very secure. The grounds are well-maintained --something my husband appreciated, since he has no time to keep our lawns trimmed and pretty! The room was clean and the luxury of having 3 sets of towels (a big plus for us long-haired people) was something I've not seen even in the high-rise hoity toity hotels of Los Angeles for a long time! I noticed kids playing in the swimming pool, which seemed to me to be a lovely thing for families, although I did not take advantage of that ammenity. What I really enjoyed was the quiet. Remember, I said that there were kids and families...well, I've been to hotels where the kids run amuck stommping up and down the halls, and this hotel was NOT one of those!! It was quiet! After brutal days of slogging through thousands of people, what a pleasure to come home to a quiet and restful place! If I have to "downgrade" at all, I would say that the breakfast area was incredibly small. It is uncomfortable to have more than a couple of families at any one time in that area, so I hope that eventually they will consider expanding. Of course, I could have gotten a tray and taken my breakfast back to the room, which is what some did, but I like the idea of having my breakfast away from the room. Overall, this was an excellent choice, one that I hope to repeat!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST rooms, staff, breakfast, location and VALUE in San Diego!!”
Reviews.Author: beckyb22
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I came to visit colleges and stayed here...The BEST location near SDSU - we walked everywhere! The staff went out of their way to ensure that everything was ready for us...EARLY! We will be back soon and only hesitate to recommend this hotel because we don't want everyone to find our little "jewel" and crowd us out =) The staff was AMAZING - thank you David and Len! The place felt like home and this is by far, the BEST VALUE ever! THANK YOU!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: thomasholme
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel was a little out of the way, it was easy to get whereever you wanted to go. That being said, it was a very nice place to stay. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The rooms where very clean and a great size. The free breakfast was more than enough.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendation is 50/50 for me”
Reviews.Author: bigdoginindy
Reviews.Content: Recommendation is 50/50 for me but I will give it. Some of the best landscaping and exterior maintenance for an motel that really shows pride. The rooms are clean, the staff is friendly and I felt they wanted our stay to be a good one. The breakfast buffet had a fair amount of variety and room rates are fair. The parking is free here, which is what I’m accustom to. Most of the other motels want up to $25 per night to “park in their lot” in the San Diego area which I think is a big rip off. The down side for me is the lighting in this “old” motel, which is some of the worst I’ve come across, good luck to the ladies needing lighting for morning make-up. Light switches are in strange places and on timers which make this place seem cheap. We also received a room with a real bad smell. They moved us asap & offered a upgrade which shows great customer service to please us. I did not know that this place allows pets which could be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: StephHopesTucson
Reviews.Content: This hotel came so recommended here, that I had no second thoughts as to my decision. I called the hotel directly, and spoke to Len. Making the reservation was just the beginning of a great experience! The grounds are very pretty, the hotel very clean, and the staff super friendly. We just did not have one problem while staying there. The location is out of the way of all the tourist attractions, which I appreciated. But, it is not so far that you cannot get to anywhere in San Diego within 15 or 20 minutes. The freeway is just down the block and around the corner. We found great pizza at Fatte's, and had a great breakfast at D Z Akins upon the recommendation from the hotel staff. This will be my place to stay from now on when I go to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Retreat From The Business of Travel”
Reviews.Author: trevan
Reviews.Content: My husband and our 21 yr. old son stayed here as we were visiting my mother, who lives off El Cajon in the North Park neighborhood. What stood out most for me was how obvious it was that great pride is taken by the entire staff to make this property impeccable. The grounds are lovely with beautiful rose bushes and bouganvilla. The cleanliness at every turn is something you just don't see that often in the hospitality industry. The breakfast buffet had a great variety. We met Dave, the manager, and he made it clear that he wanted our stay to be a great one. He printed up a map off mapquest for our son to use to visit a friend in Riverside, as we opted not to pay $10 a day for a GPS in our rent a car. The only down side was the quality of our beds. They weren't too bad, but it seemed that they could consider replacing them, as they can, in order to make the property a complete 100%. We highly recommend you consider this gem at a great price, in an unexpected location.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: drolldis
Reviews.Content: We recently went on a trip to Disneyland and decided that we would spend a night in San Diego to go to Sea World beforehand. We had never been. It was beautiful. This hotel was just right, nice value, nice pool. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great great value hotel- just too far from the action”
Reviews.Author: rtussin
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. We stayed at 8 hotels across California and this gave much better value for money than those where we paid DOUBLE the cost of these rooms! Free internet- good pool, great breakfast incl. free dvd rental, free parking. One drawback ( and it was a major one for us)- a long drive from any of the tourist sights (zoo, old town, gaslamp area, coronado)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when visiting San Diego”
Reviews.Author: SilentScream
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 1am and were promptly checked in. There still were parking spots available even at that late hour. The room was very clean and adequately furnished. The dishes in the kitchen were very clean as well. The fridge was a bit noisy, but that is expected. Breakfast items were typical continental breakfast stuff - bagels, danishes, cereal, etc. Everything was extremely fresh and hotel staff was always present to make sure that everything is stocked and everyone got everything they wanted. The hotel is near the university, so expect some younger crowd and possibly some noise late at night. The hotel is also located within 15 minutes from the most popular destinations in town.

Reviews.Title: “This excellent hotel was a big part of our awesome vacation!”
Reviews.Author: nsbarnes
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier with the Best Western Lamplighter, San Diego. The staff went out of their way to be very helpful, especially Len Regan. He not only provided information about the area, he made sure we knew directions and had any discounts that were available. The room was clean and very comfortable and the free contiental breakfast was great! We would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: KM66
Reviews.Content: We picked this motel for a three-nights-stay in San Diego. It was a very good choice. The staff (or owner?) was outstanding friendly, the whole facility was very clean, quiet and proper and the price was reasonable. We got a good breakfast and a spacy double-room with a kitchen. The right place with children in a city. Although the area is not very attractive (housing, commercial, University) there are a lot of good restaurants (test the Thay restaurant) and shops around. It seemed to be safe. The nights were quiet. We recommend this place as a "headquarter" for exploring SD. The pool is a nice place to stay after a hard tourists day.

Reviews.Title: “Super sweet value for money + clean and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: LinaE5007
Reviews.Content: We recently had a 3 day get-away to San Diego and stayed 2 nights at the Lamplighter Inn. In the past we'd stayed at the DI on hotel circle. We decided to try someplace else as frequently the DI is just too noisy. The Lamplighter was farther inland than the other hotel, but not by much. Most of our outings were to La Jolla and Sea World so still well within driving range, especially with the GPS! I have to ditto everything (most) everyone has said about the friendliness of the staff. Len suprised both my hubby and myself by remembering each of our 1st names and we were only in the office once each! Super nice person and so very helpful. We chose the room with a king and full kitchen. I made a mistake and thought the room came with a sofa bed for our 7yr old. At check in we learned this and I asked if a roll away was available and was told yes. He said give him a few min. and he'd bring it up. He not only brought it up in the time frame he stated, but also helped us to rearrange the furniture as to best fit the roll away. Being a family of vegans & a flexitarian, having the kitchenette was great! It was super clean and had kitchen supplies to cook with and all. The neighborhood isn't so bad for being near to the SDSU. No more grafitti than we see at home in areas of Tucson. There's a Ralph's grocery right down the block, a starbucks nearby for those starbucks addicts. Our internet service was fine, the pool was clean and towels provided. The breakfast was yummy with waffles, fresh coffee, oj, toast, bagels, cereal, fresh fruit, HB eggs, oatmeal, danish...... Super! The breakfast room did get a bit full, but we just took some back to our room to enjoy when that happened. Or it was suggested that you might enjoy your breakfast poolside. Everything said, we'll certainly be back to the Lamplighter the next time we get to enjoy our favorite get-away spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: jcjoe01
Reviews.Content: Best kept hotel secret in San Diego. I have paid 3-4 times what this room cost me and have not received the same level of warm professional courtesy extended at this hotel. Everyone that works here is helpful and friendly. The rooms are always spotless and had a new feel to it. The fridge, the microwave, the wireless service and the bathroom fixtures were in perfect working order. Any request was acted upon quickly and with smiles. Although not located in the best area, it has easy access to main hwys. and you can be anywhere is San Diego within 15 minutes or so. The front desk people are great at getting you easy to follow directions and tips on getting around. Its rare but some times you get more than you pay for and this hotel is one of them.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't end up staying”
Reviews.Author: travellingwithkids75
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a trip to San Diego and was scheduled to stay at the Lamplighter Inn and Suites for 4 nights. However, the day we pulled into the property, we pulled back out again. I cannot comment on the rooms, and the property itself seemed like it would be okay. However, the location was terrible. As we drove down the road heading toward the property, we did not see any family friendly restaurants or other venues- lots of graffiti, lots of noise (maybe it was party season at the University, because there were a lot of people walking around with bottles on the street) and I just didn't get a "I want to spend the next 4 nights" feeling about it. I will say the desk staff were more than helpful, and cancelled my reservation efficiently and effectively. Maybe if I had stayed long enough to see a room, I could have been convinced, and I did end up having to spend an additional $100.00/night to stay elsewhere, but I didn't feel this site adequately warned me about the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Clean. Courteous staff. Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: rachaelc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel several times from August to December 2008 and had great experiences. First, the place is a good value for the money. For those thinking it is just ok, I recommend you check the rates in the San Diego area. Second, the place is super clean. I had different rooms each time (different floors and both buildings) and everything was spotless. I asked about the carpets since they always look and smell so clean and was told the staff rotates rooms to steam clean weekly so that every rooms' carpet gets steam cleaned monthly. What a difference! I have stayed in 4 stars where I wouldn't remove my shoes. OK, so I didn't get over that neurosis here, but it looked great and I thought about it. Third plus is the convenient location off the freeway. The fourth big woo hoo was that I was able to bring my cat. Is the food gourmet? No. But it is a nice continental breakfast with pastries, cereal, bread etc. I just need something light to start my day so this was great for me. If you need a hearty hot breakfast, there are plenty of places nearby. I do agree with other travelers in that that you can sometimes hear people next to you. This was only a problem one time I stayed at the hotel - my neighbors had the tv volume up until after midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: GlennieMarin
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel while visiting SDSU. I am a stickler for cleanliness when travelling and I must say my hotel room was spotless. Being on the ground floor, I was worried about noise at night. I didn't hear any noice all night. The mattress was as comfortable as hotel rooms where I have paid $400/nt. The complimentary breakfast, friendly front desk service and great price make it a great spot to stay in San Diego. My family and I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value; very helpful & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JNewsom
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here last week for our visit to San Diego. It was conveniently located near I-8, but far enough away to eliminate highway noise. We could get to downtown, Coronado, Old Town, the Zoo, and Sea World within 20-30 minutes depending on traffic. The staff were very helpful including a great recommendation for dinner. The breakfast room had a good variety of bread & bagels from a local bakery, assorted muffins & pastries, a waffle-making station, hard-boiled eggs, fruit, cereal, juice & coffee. The gentleman that stocked the breakfast area was very friendly, as were all the other staff we had interactions with. The motel itself and the room were definitely older, but everything was clean and in good repair. The bed was nice and firm (a big plus for me, but not for everyone). I would recommend this motel to anyone looking for a nice stay at a very reasonable price. I even told my parents to stay here when they come to San Diego in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - Close to all Tourist Attractions by Car”
Reviews.Author: murstel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and booked this motel because of reviews on tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. Room was very clean, bed was great and there was no noise. By freeway, it is very close to downtown, Olde Town, the Zoo, La Jolla etc - only 15-20 minutes if not in commuter traffic. Staff was very helpful - there is an excellent Italian restaurant (does not look like very much) very close and quite inexpensive - they will deliver and they make a fabulous pizza. The only problem we encountered was that a maid exchanged 1/3 of my bottle of vodka for water - no big deal - but I noticed because I drink my vodka only with water! Mentioned the incident to the night manager and had no further problems. My only suggestion to the motel would be to think about providing a small safe for medications, jewelry and passports etc - it would be comforting especially for non U.S. citizens. I definitely would stay here again - once you get to know the streets and turnoffs, it is amazingly easy to get around everywhere quickly. Breakfast was fine - to me it is a bonus. We were a little leery of area at first but it is fine. This is a large city and a busy street - once you get your bearings, you will be fine. Supermarket (Ralphs), pharmacies, liquor stores within 5 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite places”
Reviews.Author: JDTravelCanada
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place to stay in the San Diego area. We booked this one because of reviews from Tripadvisor. Hotel was very clean and well looked after. The front desk staff was very nice and very helpful. Our favorite part was after a long day at theme parks, Mexico we would return to play in the pool. Pool was clean, average size and has lights all around at night. Hotel made you feel like you were at home or in your own backyard. It is in your typical suburban area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Reasonably Priced, So So Location”
Reviews.Author: Shotlady
Reviews.Content: I came down to San Diego for a family get together a few miles from the motel and decided I would stay here for the night instead of making the 2 hour trip back to my home. I chose the Lamplighter Inn because of TA reviews and it was close by. The room was clean, the beds comfortable, plenty of clean towels and the price was right - around $80 for a Saturday night with Auto Club discount. Property is well maintained and pool area is clean. Very friendly, very helpful front desk staff and housekeepers. I think this is why this Best Western is so highly rated. The breakfast was OK, there is waffle batter and waffle irons available if you wanted something besides cereal, bagels and such. Wasn't really crazy with the area immediately around the motel. I was a little disappointing because I didn't think it would be so blah - based on the reviews. It really is not a "tourist" area by any means. I would probably stay here again but would only recommend to the budget minded vacationer.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliness, service and cleanliness are way beyond expectations.”
Reviews.Author: rndthebend
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in, the service at Lamplighter was warm and friendly. It's always encouraging to have employees tell us how happy they are to work at a facility. Our room was very comfortable, even more than we had hoped for! The area was quiet. We've stayed at other hotels in the same price range and not gotten half the service or comfort. The location to attractions and things we wanted to do was great, especially with El Cajon being a main thoroughfare. The street was not too busy to navigate. The breakfast room tends to be a little crowded but a great breakfast makes up for that. The smallness of the room encourages you to get to know other guests.Overall, the stay was a premium stay for a non-premium price.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel in conventient location”
Reviews.Author: juniorjetclub
Reviews.Content: Len, do you work 24/7?! VERY helpful, friendly staff and a good, clean hotel. Not in the middle of town, but 20mins to the centre is fine & easy. Would stay here again without hesitation. Many thanks

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lives up to the Reviews”
Reviews.Author: elewis
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel from the reviews. Len Regan the Manager couldn't have been more helpful. He greeted us by our first names anytime he saw us which is a real plus. Even though the hotel is not downtown all the main tourist attractions are no more than 20 minutes away by car and easily accessible. Our first night we went to Pizzeria Luige at 2121 El Cajon after seeing a review on "Diners, Drive Ins and Dives" on the Food Network. It is the best pizza we have had which includes New York and Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice people”
Reviews.Author: Weijers
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay; not in the city but with the car only 20 minutes drive

Reviews.Title: “Good except breakfast is way overrated”
Reviews.Author: mysei
Reviews.Content: Stay there for three nights. The room was okay. The facility was kept very well. Pool was heated. Staff very friendly. Bed was comfortable. I read a lot about their breakfast being awesome. It was the typical breakfast for a Best Western. Small room but the food was typical -- juice, coffee, cereal, waffles, muffins, fruit. I would stay there again as price was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Randalljay
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine that anyone could find better value. The price is right; the rooms were excellent. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good with lots of variety. The location is also very good if you have a car and expect to travel around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest, affordable place in Sandiego”
Reviews.Author: Vernontravellers
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 3 children and husband. David and Len made sure our stay was magnificant!! Sooooo friendly, remembered our names everyday (that sais alot). Super helpful. Clean, Comfy beds and rooms. I am very particular and would recomend this hotel to anyone in any situation. Can't wait to visit again. The Ryder's

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with this place”
Reviews.Author: tednugent_10
Reviews.Content: What an upside surprise for our trip. We were going to stay at the hotel coronado, but decided to save some money, and were prepared for antiseptic rooms and a tired breakfast. We got the exact opposite with spotless, fresh smelling rooms, friendly service, and a bountiful breakfast every morning. The kids loved being able to make their own waffles. Will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Believe The Good Reviews”
Reviews.Author: SandS_10
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel strictly based on the reviews and we were not disappointed. Having never stayed in San Diego before we did not know any of the local areas, this hotel met our goal of clean and affordable accommodation. The front desk staff was very friendly and extremely helpful regarding information about (including driving directions to) local restaurants and attractions. You will need a vehicle but it is a short drive to The Zoo and Downtown. The breakfast was also very good, a nice way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, clean room and pleasent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jasmine6596
Reviews.Content: The prior night I stayed at the Lafayette Hotel which was a horrible experience. The next day we ran out like a bats out of hell and was greeted warmly by all the staff at this Best Western. Awesome complimentary breakfast in a clean and cozy breakfast room. Heated pool which I wish I couldv'e went in however I forgot my bathing suit. Vending machines which were convenient. Free dvd rentals, and a very comfortable bed. I definately would stay at this hotel again whenever I'm in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Ehh”
Reviews.Author: THoneycutt
Reviews.Content: this hotel was modern. It did not have the "wow" factor of most hotels I have stayed at. The guest service was ok but not to the extent it should be. The beds were extremly comfortable. Over all I say it was fair. I travel a lot and think that friendlieness is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms comfy beds & nice brekfast”
Reviews.Author: GBDK
Reviews.Content: Ample breakfast with plenty of choice. We could hear a little noise from the room next door but not too bad. Beds were comfy and clean. Area was very ordinary although we never felt unsafe.Our only negative is that they would not accept our debit travel card which was annoying( the only place that wouldn't in 3 weeks of traveling in the US) We discovered a nice little Italian restaurant nearby called "Cucina Freshca & sons" with good old fashioned service and home style cooked food.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: lemur123
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and comfortable. The front desk clerk was always helpful and accommodating to our needs and requests. There was a computer and printer with internet access in the lobby and free DVD rentals, all very convenient. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down, THE BEST hotel experience we've EVER had.”
Reviews.Author: NRGNRG
Reviews.Content: Very tired from traveling for three days, we arrived to find that our room was upgraded to a suite at no extra charge! David, Len and the rest of the staff practically treated us like family during our three-day stay. We are relocating from the Pacific Northwest and these people gave us an amazing first impression to San Diego. We have stayed in so many hotels over the years and have simply never been treated better. The room and service was impeccable and there is only one hotel in town that we will ever refer family and friends to when they come to visit. Keep up the great work! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: CPA52
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed. Staff were very helpful and friendly, the rooms very clean with comfortable beds.
