Although the hotel is located at El Cajon Blvd, which isn’t a busy street but not a side road either, I didn't notice any disturbing street noise. I also didn’t experience any problems finding a parking space close to my room. Some people might argue that the hotel is not that close to downtown, but then again it is very close to San Diego State University and other interesting venues, so I found it to be an ideal location for me. Breakfast, which was offered between 6 and 10 a.m., was way better than you would expect it to be at a regular Best Western hotel. The breakfast bar was well-stocked with appealing choices, which included waffles, a nice variety of cereals, fresh fruit and assorted pastries. Complimentary coffee was offered in the lobby throughout the day. Although I have never been in the pool it looked very nice and fresh towels were put out every day. The most important thing for me, however, was that the hotel was absolutely clean and that everyone who worked there always strived to provide prompt and outstanding service. Housekeeping was simply amazing, they would rather replace a towel that had not been used or put an extra piece of soap than forget to replace anything. Last but not least, I have to thank all at Best Western Lamplighter Inn (which includes, but is not limited to Len, the amazing front office manager who goes out of his way to give you a pleasant stay) for their help in facilitating my transition to the US and for making my stay a time to remember. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn’t want to spend hundreds of dollars a night, but also doesn't want to compromise quality for money. Lamplighter Inn is kind of a hard-to-find gem, as it gets you more value for your dollar than possibly any other hotel in San Diego. Almost forgot to mention that I stayed there 26 days after all.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Bargin”
Reviews.Author: SALMEX
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The staff was fantastic and very courteous. Overall, the hotel was a bargain! The price was very reasonable and the breakfast bar, which was included in the price, was delicious. About David Birt, the general manager, here is a man who really cares about the property he manages. He was very friendly and helpful. Made sure that we were totally satisfied with out stay. I would totally recommend the Best Western Lamplighter Inn to anyone traveling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal off the beaten path!”
Reviews.Author: trainergina
Reviews.Content: A little far away from downtown SD but for the value and price it was a great find!!! The staff was helpful the guest were nice. It may be on a busy road but it was extremely quite. The room for continental breakfast was very nice. The room we stayed in was a kitchen suite the ceiling was slopped which gave it an interesting look. The pool was very clean and it was a nice area of town. Easy access on and off highways as well.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Stay! Thank You!”
Reviews.Author: M_GO_BLUE_A2
Reviews.Content: After reading the Tripadvisor reviews, we decided to book our six-night stay here. This was our first trip to San Diego and we weren't quite sure about the neighborhoods, and I must admit I was a bit hesitant given the great deal we received for a room with a kitchen and the extra for our dog. We were not at all disappointed!!!! The rooms were basic, but clean (the most important thing to most!) There was a queen bed and sofa bed so plenty of room for my husband, daughter and me. Our room had a full kitchen, complete with fridge, stove and microwave. Great setup! The complimentary breakfast was plenty to get us started in the morning; toast, cereal, oatmeal, boiled eggs, pastries and fruit were fine although I must admit I wasn't a big fan of the coffee. The pet area was a bit on the small side so we typically would take our dog for a walk in the morning to take care of her business. Many of the reviews reference the small breakfast area. It probably is much more crowded during the summer, but during Thanksgiving week, we had no problems with seating. For our visits to Sea World, the Zoo, Old Town and all the other touristy spots, the drive was roughly 15-20 minutes, more or less depending upon the time of day. It never seemed to take very long and was an easy drive with our GPS. Easy access on/off the freeways. We found parking at the hotel to be no problem. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit, especially if we bring our dog, as there aren't many nice, clean hotels/motels which allow dogs weighing more than 30 lbs (ours weighs 50+) Thanks, BW Lamplighter, for the wonderful stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “bargain break”
Reviews.Author: ashcan
Reviews.Content: Chosen after looking at tripadvisor and not disappointed. Stayed for 2 days at a great rate of 102$ incl taxes etc for a double queen room. The staff were friendly, efficient and we had no problems. The room on the ground floor was standard: TV, coffee maker, bathroom, the only thing missing was a fridge. The pool was good , mad brits and englishman in at 2000, too cool for the locals but warm for us! Breakfast was basic , not the best we'd had consisting of cereal/toast/doughnuts. It was near small conveniance stores and about 5 mins drive from the I8 (?) freeway. Overall a good budget stay in a quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, and Understanding service!”
Reviews.Author: PoorYoungFellow
Reviews.Content: After a 2 day nightmare just up the street at the howard Johnson the Best Western was like paradise. the staff was amazing and the room was even better! clean, spacious, and organized. they even bumped us up to a mini suite after explaining what we had been through. i would recomend this hotel to anyone working on a budget and still looking for great service.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: RedrockNV
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here two nights in dual queen bed second floor room booked under discount rate via Costco website. Location is extremely convenient to metro San Diego attractions (less than five miles to San Diego Zoo / Balboa Park). This along with previous reviews is why I selected it. Property is relatively close to SDSU, so area has a college feel. Banks, eateries, supermarkets, drug stores, hospital, gas stations and freeway access points are all close at hand. The L&L Hawaiian BBQ place at the corner (of El Cajon and College) served great take-out fare. I will say that the area is older, and I wouldn't recommend wandering about alone too late in the evening. At check-in, the female desk clerk was pleasant, friendly, and provided great information. Check-out was less involved and less noteworthy. Property is older, but kept well, second level is stair access only, and exterior access room was clean, though the HVAC unit did give off a strange odor at times during operation. I did not sample the breakfast, or pool area, so have no opinion regarding these amenities. Parking stalls fill quickly at night and were quite narrow; I did worry about finding door dings on my new van, but smaller vehicles should manage. If you're looking to be impressed with your room at a higher rate, I recommend the brand new Residence Inn Oceanside, CA where I also stayed during this trip (convenient to Legoland, beaches, pier). The Lamplighter Inn's selling attributes are price point, location, convenience and service in reasonably clean accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTerry
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very clean, rooms comfortable and quite. Front desk very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: kidney1
Reviews.Content: This was a very clean hotel. The staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. Quiet area of town with easy to find freeway access from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lots to do!”
Reviews.Author: AKLilac
Reviews.Content: This motel was rated fairly high, so that is why I chose to stay here. The area that this is in, is not the greatest and as a single female, was not comfortable in this area. The motel itself is a typical motel. The only thing I really missed was an insulated ice bucket to keep ice colder, longer. I went in October and it was hot(mid-70's). It was impossible to keep water bottles from being room temperature and I was not there long enough to warrant buying a cooler. I also chose this motel because the manager was responding to bad reviews(and good ones) and took steps to correct problems. That showed me that he cared about what went on under his roof and he cared. The location made it fairly easy to get to everything. The price that I paid was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Pool”
Reviews.Author: nordicwalker
Reviews.Content: We had a queen room with kitchen, which is great if you don't want to eat out every day. There are two supermarkets minutes away so you can buy from the salad bar or pick up a microwave meal. Luckily I had cutlery and paper plates with me for use on picnics because although the kitchen has a cooker, fridge etc. - there is no equipment i.e. saucepan, plate etc. Our son had a kingsize room which had an ant invasion the morning after we arrived. I informed the desk before breakfast and was told it would be taken care of by housekeeping staff. After breakfast there were even more ants so I went back to reception. The manager apologised, gave our son an upgrade and a reduction in price for the inconvenience. All this was done in a very friendly manner. All in all the motel is very clean and the compimentary breakfast was fine. The pool was the best of all the hotels we stayed at this trip (6 in all) - the water temperature was perfect, it was big enough to swim lengths and a beautiful tree provided shade to sit under. The grounds of the motel were perfectly kept with some lovely plants and vegetation.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Lamplighter Inn & Suites at SDSU
HotelInfo.Address: 6474 El Cajon Blvd., San Diego, CA 92115
